name: biomni-find-n-glycosylation-motifs
title: Biomni: Find N Glycosylation Motifs
description: Scan a protein sequence for N-linked glycosylation sequons (N-X-[S/T])
content:
Overview

This tool identifies N-linked glycosylation motifs (sequons) in protein sequences using the canonical N-X-[S/T] pattern, where X is any amino acid except proline. N-glycosylation is a critical post-translational modification that affects protein folding, stability, trafficking, and function. The tool scans protein sequences to locate potential N-glycosylation sites, which are essential for designing therapeutic proteins, optimizing recombinant protein expression, and engineering glycoproteins with desired properties.

Input Parameters

  • sequence (string, required): The protein sequence to analyze in single-letter amino acid code (e.g., 'MNKTSVILQGPPGTGKTSLAKALAAQNAIGVLIGP'). The sequence should contain standard amino acid letters.
  • allow_overlap (boolean, optional, default: false): Whether to allow overlapping motifs to be reported. When set to true, overlapping N-X-S/T patterns will all be identified. When false, only non-overlapping motifs are reported.

Input Format

The input should be a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "sequence": "MNKTSVILQGPPGTGKTSLAKALAAQNAIGVLIGP",
  "allow_overlap": false
}

Biological Use Case

N-glycosylation site identification is crucial for:

  • Therapeutic protein design: Identifying and optimizing glycosylation sites in monoclonal antibodies, fusion proteins, and enzyme replacement therapies to improve pharmacokinetics and reduce immunogenicity.
  • Protein engineering: Removing or adding N-glycosylation sites to modulate protein expression levels, solubility, and biological activity.
  • Biosimilar development: Ensuring glycosylation patterns match reference products by identifying all potential N-glycosylation sites.
  • Structure-function studies: Understanding how N-glycosylation affects protein conformation and interactions with receptors or other biomolecules.

Output

The tool generates a JSON file (glycosylation_motifs.json) containing a list of identified N-glycosylation motifs. Each motif includes the position in the sequence, the specific sequon pattern found, and the amino acid context. The output provides actionable information for site-directed mutagenesis, glycoengineering strategies, and expression optimization.

Category

glycoengineering
